newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper ends barely lower in thin session.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper ends barely lower in thin session.

text.p: COMEX copper settled barely weaker and well off the day's lows in lackluster trading which became choppy at times because of thin volume which made it difficult to see any direction in the market.

"The Sumitomo story still has some repercussions, and the expectation is for a modest stock increase on LME tomorrow and that's keeping downside pressure," said Bette Raptopoulos of Prudential Securities.
The tumble in LME aluminum to a 2-1/4 year low also dampened copper and other base metals. The Yom Kippur holiday and Japan's public holiday reduced the level of activity in New York and overseas.
December COMEX settled 0.15 cent weaker at 87.65 cents per pound, traded 87.95 to 86.60 cents. Spot September was off 0.75 cent at 88.25 cents.
Volume was an estimated 4,000 lots by 1300 EDT, an hour before close of trade.
